Comment: A sound opening move from white - an other possible move would be e4.
Black plays d5 the best response to d4
Nf3 lends support to the d pawn whilst also taking control of the e5 square. This is a strong move in the race between black and white to control the centre of the board
The natural reply to Nf3. Black protects the d pawn whilst gaining control of the important e4 square.
e3 lends further support to the d pawn, it also controls the f4 square. This move also allows the light bishop to move.
e6 gives support to the d pawn giving the dark bishop room to move. I also gains control of the f5 square.
This move gives a further defender to the d pawn controls the c4 square and also allows the queen the option to move to the queen side for a possible attack in time.
c5 is a direct challenge for control of the centre by attacking the d pawn. At the moment this is not a real threat as the d pawn is protected by 3 pieces and only attacked once.
Nbd2 gives a second control on the c4 square whilst also keeping a watchful eye on the e4 square
